about_the_game:
"Death and Tactics" is a top-down Strategy RPG inspired by "Lisa: The Painful" and the "Fire Emblem" series with a heavy focus on permanent death elements.  With 50 playable characters, each with their own unique items to unlock and events to experience depending on on who lives and who dies in your party, "Death and Tactics" is an incredibly replayable experience where your choices in the gameplay have long lasting consequences.

One of the overall goals is to be a Strategy RPG that doesn't waste your time. Permanent death is incorporated into almost every system to create convenience. Players won't ever feel pressured to grind, reset, etc, if one of their party members falls in battle. Each death creates a new strategic opportunity for the player to explore.

20 years after nuclear bombs wiped out most of humanity, mutants wander the earth and the last remnants of humanity are divided. While some leaders decided to take a more "old-school" approach to governance...

Others have had... more unique ideas on how to take advantage of the apocalypse to, say the least...

During the events of the story, you play as Tanya, a young woman in her 20s, an aspiring playwright, and owner of a mutated horse.

However, her happy-go-lucky life is soon interrupted by the cruel realities that come with trying to survive in the apocalypse. Join her and her friends as they undergo a journey of loss, vengeance, and growth across this ruined world and interact with the freaks that inhabit it.

-50 playable characters.

-The "Rage" system, which powers up your party members if their loved ones fall in battle.

-Selling the organs of the party members you don't like for money.

-A "well meaning" weapons manufacturer that will frequently offer you new and unique weapons to spice up your strategies. 

-A pair of personal fitness trainers to level up any of your party members if they've fallen behind, ensuring that all 50 characters are usable throughout the story.

-Alternative events with unlockable items and skills depending on how you've played the game.

-Over 100 skills. 

-A deep strategic experience.

If you would like to keep up with official updates of the game on social media, our official accounts can be found here on twitter at "@DeathAndTactics" and on Blue Sky at "@deathandtactics.bsky.social".

content_descriptors.notes: This game heavily deals with themes of death and loss, as well as how some people may cope with these situations such as turning to violence or drug use. As such, the game might not be suitable for all audiences.
